$ZIM
Probably worth pointing out that more recent EPS consensus for Q4 ‚Äò22 is closer to 2.21-2.26 which makes the estimated upcoming dividend range $0.66-$8.44.

But I sincerely doubt that the top-up will be the full 20% as it is repeatedly labeled as optional by the ZIM executive team; and a company facing 2 years of negative estimated earnings(est. EPS of -$1.52 FY ‚Äò23 & -4.95 FY ‚Äò24) would be handicapping themselves for any planned investments by emptying their coffers for an optional one-time outlay.

So much more likely is 5-10% top-up which put the pretax dividend amount at between $2.54 - $4.42. Then deduct 25% foreign dividend withholding tax (unless you pay substantial dividend taxes already) for a net of $1.91-3.32.
All this risk for a very underwhelming yield followed by possibly no dividends until 2025. And the real possibility of a 66 cent dividend is disappointing to say the least.

body: $ZIM ... common pattern with this stock. If the dividend is $5
created_at: then the stock will be up by the same amount until the day before ex-dividend date ie. $27. Then

body: @Hanna22 2/2 $ZIM would be a stock that people could love long-term but benefit from the swings of the market.
It's typical for investors to enter their position and after the date of record to be rewarded with the dividend payout
created_at: sell upwards of 80-95% of their position to recoup their investments as well as paying themselves the profits from dividend plus any additional stock value increase.

body: It's typical for a stock that doesn't pay a flat regular dividend to decrease in value after quarterly dividend payouts
created_at: so getting out before the expected decline allows you to wait on the price drop to re-enter at a discount.

body: In the case of $ZIM
created_at: expected re-entry could be in the 15-18 dollars range within two weeks following the dividend record date.

body: Investors do this
created_at: because if you're just continuously putting money in
column3: without paying yourself the profits of the increases in value
column4: it's highly likely to be left 'holding the bag' so to speak

body: @Hanna22 if your goal is to just buy in

body: Just because you're long on a stock
